entry.title: Referee named for Celtic vs Inverness Scottish Cup final
entry.summary: The Scottish FA have confirmed the refereeing appointments for the showpiece final.

entry.title: Ange Postecoglou link that won't go away: Celtic manager 'on four-man shortlist' for Spurs but other candidate far likelier
entry.summary: Tottenham Hotspur continue to be linked with Celtic boss Ange Postecoglou as they mull over who to appoint as their manager for next season.

entry.title: Tottenham manager latest as Celtic's Postecoglou remains on shortlist
entry.summary: The Parkhead boss is included in a four-man shortlist for the Premier League position.

entry.title: The Celtic record on the line as champions could surpass Lisbon Lions
entry.summary: Ange Postecoglou's side have two games remaining against Hibs and Aberdeen.

entry.title: St Mirren reveal Celtic player who was deliberately targeted in 2-2 draw - 'it's not something you would ignore'
entry.summary: Curtis Main has revealed that St Mirren deliberately targeted Tomoki Iwata ahead of their 2-2 draw with Celtic.

entry.title: Kyogo Furuhashi eyes permanent place on Celtic Park walls as striker spared from St Mirren criticism
entry.summary: Given the almost childlike enthusiasm with which he energetically celebrates every victory, it should probably not come as a huge surprise to see Kyogo Furuhashi continue to whizz around the park in these end-of-season dead rubber contests as if his life depended on it.

entry.title: Fran Alonso: Forget title, Celtic changed Scottish women's football
entry.summary: Fran Alonso has told his players that they have changed the landscape of Scottish women’s football despite failing to land a first SWPL title this season.There was heartbreak for Celtic after they came within two minutes of winning their inaugural league with an emotional Alonso left to console his visibly distraught players in the aftermath of an afternoon when they were so near yet so far.

entry.title: Celtic, Rangers and Glasgow City serve up 'movie' climax as SWPL trophy arrives at Parkhead only to depart for Ibrox
entry.summary: Fran Alonso’s Miami Vice look was back at Celtic Park yesterday afternoon. By the time this game was over, however, the look was spoiled by the need for a sick bag.

entry.title: Celtic and Rangers dejection as Glasgow City clinch SWPL title after stoppage time drama at Ibrox
entry.summary: Glasgow City have emerged as champions with Rangers and Celtic left dejected after a thrilling climax to the Scottish Women's Premier League season.

entry.title: Glasgow City win the SWPL title as Celtic and Rangers fall short
entry.summary: The Scottish Women's Premier League draws to a close this Sunday with three clubs still in with a chance of lifting the title we are in for a huge afternoon of action. Glasgow City, Celtic and Rangers can all still become champions, but who can hold their nerve? Stay tuned on our LIVE blog to find out.

entry.title: Rangers, Celtic & Glasgow City go for title LIVE: SWPL Helicopter Sunday
entry.summary: The Scottish Women's Premier League draws to a close this Sunday with three clubs still in with a chance of lifting the title we are in for a huge afternoon of action. Glasgow City, Celtic and Rangers can all still become champions, but who can hold their nerve? Stay tuned on our LIVE blog to find out.

entry.title: What channel is Rangers v Glasgow City? What channel is Celtic Women v Hearts? TV details for SWPL title deciders
entry.summary: One of Celtic, Rangers or Glasgow City will be crowned Scottish Women's Premier League champions on Sunday as an epic three-way battle for the title reaches a dramatic conclusion.

entry.title: SWPL final day: Glasgow City, Celtic and Rangers all set for title shootout - the numbers will add up for someone
entry.summary: There is no need for helicopters to change direction when the distance to Ibrox or Celtic Park is a simple hop, skip and a jump away. This afternoon’s motorbike outrider, however, would be better served with an abacus rather than a sat nav.

entry.title: Celtic reaction: Crowd drift telling; Lisbon Lions high still beatable; few cup final concerns
entry.summary: A dynamic St Mirren came close to giving Celtic a real bloody nose in the champions’ own backyard BY twice taking the lead before being pegged back in the clubs’ 2-2 draw. The encounter betrayed that Ange Postecoglou’s men are struggling to retain their edge post-title win and engendered some random musings.

entry.title: Celtic fans recall skipping exams and getting engaged in Seville
entry.summary: On the 20th anniversary of a historic event, the fans who were there share their stories and memories.

entry.title: SWPL promises to deliver final day drama
entry.summary: Three teams have a realistic chance of winning the title, and the women's domestic game may finally get its afternoon in the spotlight.

entry.title: Celtic transformed from Ferrari to jalopy in latest misfire
entry.summary: For a team that purports to never stop, Celtic are giving an awfully strong impression of having begun to grind to a halt.

entry.title: St Mirren manager Stephen Robinson in 'we deserved to win' claim following Celtic Park showing
entry.summary: St Mirren manager Stephen Robinson believes his players did not receive their just desserts for a fizzing display against the champions in their own backyard.

entry.title: Ange Postecoglou makes 'heavyweight champion of world' comment after questions over St Mirren draw
entry.summary: Celtic manager Ange Postecoglou accepted his team have deviated from their core principles following their struggles that required them to twice come from behind to dig out a 2-2 draw with a vibrant St Mirren.

entry.title: Ange Postecoglou in Celtic 'heavyweight champion' response to critics
entry.summary: Ange Postecoglou fired back at critics as Celtic failed to defeat St Mirren.

entry.title: Seville memories and 'sensational' Man City whet Celtic's European appetite as champions prepare to return home
entry.summary: There should be a carnival atmosphere at Parkhead this afternoon as the majority of the Celtic support get their first chance to acclaim their freshly-crowned champions.

entry.title: What Liam Scales said about Aberdeen and Celtic future, pre-season plans and his 'love' playing for the Dons
entry.summary: As things stand, Liam Scales will report to Celtic for pre-season after taking a much-needed holiday following an Aberdeen season which has been somewhat of a rollercoaster.

entry.title: St Mirren won't give Celtic guard of honour at Parkhead
entry.summary: The Buddies boss confirmed the decision was made at a higher level.

entry.title: Celtic fringe player 'agrees three-year contract extension'

entry.summary: Aberdeen boss Barry Robson has called on Scottish clubs to “get together” regarding away supporters.

entry.summary: Callum McGregor has no doubts that Celtic can maintain their status as the top dogs in Scottish football despite Rangers outlining plans to knock them off their perch.

entry.title: Celtic captain Callum McGregor bats away Rangers 'dominant team' claim

entry.title: Mulgrew responds to Dundee United critics over Celtic Hydro show
entry.summary: Charlie Mulgrew has responded to his Dundee United critics after his decision to appear at a Celtic charity fundraiser.

entry.title: Charlie Mulgrew breaks silence on Celtic Scott Brown event - 'my full focus is on Dundee United'
entry.summary: Charlie Mulgrew has stressed his appearance at Thursday night’s tribute event for his former Celtic team-mate and captain Scott Brown at the OVO Hydro in Glasgow will have no bearing on Dundee United's on-going battle to avoid relegation.

entry.summary: Jim Goodwin has urged Dundee United fans to relax over Charlie Mulgrew's decision to appear at a Celtic charity evening.

entry.title: Callum McGregor details Celtic 'hurt' after Rangers loss

entry.title: Steven Gerrard Rangers record dug out by Barnes over Celtic grievance
entry.summary: The Liverpool and England legend believes that black managers are not afforded the same opportunities as those who are white.

entry.title: Celtic vs St Mirren: Live stream, TV channel & team news

entry.title: Celtic transfer decision on Liam Scales on hold until the summer
entry.summary: The defender has been an impressive figure in the Dons backline this season, particularly since Barry Robson took over the side in late January.

entry.title: Ange in Celtic tribute to key duo he was determined to stick with
entry.summary: Ange Postecoglou may be the frontman, but the Celtic manager is adamant his backroom team deserve just as much limelight.
